intro: Lastrea syrmatica, commonly known as the Cape Harebell, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its foliage consists of narrow, hairy leaves that help reduce water loss in arid conditions. Lastrea syrmatica is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
